That's a great plan! Establishing a relaxing bedtime routine and creating a sleep-conducive environment can make a huge difference in the quality of your sleep.

**Essential Oils and Calming Teas:** Experimenting with essential oils and calming teas can be a great way to unwind before bed. Some popular essential oils for relaxation include lavender, chamomile, and bergamot. You can use a diffuser or apply a few drops to your pulse points. As for calming teas, try herbal options like chamomile, peppermint, or valerian root tea.

**Cooler and Darker Bedroom:** Keeping your bedroom cooler and darker can help regulate your body's natural sleep-wake cycle. Aim for a temperature between 60-67°F (15-19°C) and use blackout curtains or shades to block out any harsh light.

**Additional Tips:**

1. **Try progressive muscle relaxation:** This technique involves tensing and relaxing different muscle groups in your body to release tension. Start with your toes and work your way up to your head.
2. **Write in a journal:** Writing down your thoughts and feelings can help clear your mind and process your emotions before bed.
3. **Avoid heavy meals before bed:** Eating a large meal close to bedtime can disrupt your sleep. Try to finish eating at least 2-3 hours before bedtime.
4. **Get some morning sunlight:** Exposure to natural light in the morning helps regulate your circadian rhythms, making it easier to fall asleep and wake up.

Remember, it may take some time to figure out what works best for you, so be patient and experiment with different techniques. And don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance.

You're doing great, and I'm confident that with a few adjustments, you'll be sleeping like a pro in no time!
